org.transitime.avl

Class AvlJmsClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.modules.Module
      • org.transitime.avl.AvlJmsClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AvlJmsClient
extends Module
    Reads AVL data from JMS topic and processes it. Can use multiple threads to do the processing.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start(java.lang.String clientName,
         int maxAVLQueueSize,
         int numberThreads,
         Core core)
                  throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                         javax.naming.NamingException
        Initiates the processing of the AVL data in separate threads.
        Parameters:
        clientName - Specifies name of JMS topic to read AVL data from. Topic name is clientName + "-AVLTopic".
        maxAVLQueueSize - How large the AVL queue can be before will block inserting additional reports from the JMS feed.
        numberThreads - How many threads to be used to simultaneous process the AVL data by AVLCients. For systems that receive a very high volume of data using multiple threads allows a server to be more fully utilized. This is especially true if the processing of the AVL data takes a lot of IO time or is simply computationally expensive. Must be between 1 and MAX_THREADS.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException
        javax.jms.JMSException

      • getTopicName

        public static java.lang.String getTopicName(java.lang.String projectId)
        Returns the name of the JMS topic to be used for the AVL feed.
        Parameters:
        projectId - Topic name is clientName + "-AVLTopic".
        Returns:
        the topic name for the AVL feed

      • run

        public void run()
        So that Runnable interface used for each thread. Makes sure that runs continuously even if an exception is thrown. Should not be called directly.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Just for testing.
        Parameters:
        args -
